pageContext.claim: “Why didn’t President Obama do something about the so-called Russian Meddling when he was told about it by the FBI before the Election? Because he thought Crooked Hillary was going to win, and he didn’t want to upset the apple cart! He was in charge, not me, and did nothing.”
pageContext.analysis: President Obama did do something about the Russian interference in the U.S. election. He spoke to the Russian president and he notified Congressional Leadership asking that they release a bipartisan statement. The Republican leadership declined to act. Obama, however, was careful not to do anything in the public eye for fear of the perception he was tipping the election.
